steps.conclusion: None. Titles follow the rules: Title Case, no levels or joiners, correct language (Spain Spanish), includes “Derecho Penal” and relevant related topics; output format is a proper JSON array.

Minor description phrasing issues: in Spain Spanish, “seguridad social” is misleading here and should be “seguridad pública” or “seguridad ciudadana”; slight conceptual nuance where “Derecho Penal Internacional” description leans toward transnational crime/cooperation rather than international criminal law; these do not affect title compliance.

Broaden catalog with additional relevant titles such as “Teoría del Delito”, “Derecho Penitenciario”, “Derecho Penal Económico”, “Compliance Penal”, “Prueba en el Proceso Penal” o “Ejecución Penal”; refine the two descriptions noted for precision in Spain Spanish terminology.

All other titles comply with rules and include the Chilean jurisdiction.

Adjust Spain Spanish terminology while keeping the Chile scope, e.g., use "Derecho Mercantil Chileno" instead of "Derecho Comercial Chileno", and consider "Derecho Internacional Público de Chile" for clarity; optionally broaden coverage with highly relevant Chile-specific areas like "Derecho Minero Chileno", "Derecho de Aguas Chileno", "Derecho de Protección de los Consumidores Chileno" o "Derecho Procesal Chileno".
